Form : log(base,num): log(3,125)*log(5,81)=z
log(3,5^3)*log(5,3^4)=z
3log(3,5)*4log(5,3)=z
12 log(3,5)*log(5,3)=z
(Log(a,b)*log(b,a)=1 
Proof would be: b=a^log(a,b)
a=b^log(b,a)=(a^log(a,b))^log(b,a)=a^(log(a,b)log(b,a))==a=> log(a,b)log(b,a)=1


12 log(3,5)*log(5,3)=z
12=z

comments.text:
Solved in 15 seconds
Answer : 12
I have seen similar problems just swap the numbers
Move 5 in place of 3 and 3 in place of 5
3^x = 81
5^y = 125
X = 4
Y = 3
Xy = 12
comments.author: @RazaArcX

comments.text:
I solved without trigonometry.
3^x = 125
5^y = 81.
Add both equations.
3^x + 5^y = 125 + 81
3^x + 5^y = 5³ + 3⁴
By comparison, 
x = 4 ; y = 3.
xy = 4 × 3 = 12. Simple
comments.author: @Boyzzzgameryoutube0001

comments.text:
3^x=125=5^3
Or 3=5^(3/x)

Now 5^y=81=3^4
Or 5^y={(5^(3/x))}4
Or 5^y=5^(12/x)
Or 5^xy=5^12
==>>xy=12

I did not use logarithm. I don't know how to use logarithm either😅
